replies.body:
Camouflage now only post lvl 6... so basically her early ganks will be total ass and remove exactly what you were actually doing with her to gain momentum in the game? *sigh*

EDIT : Sorry for the kneejerk reaction, as was pointed out Charm(or more likely the slow) aswell as the mini-lunge on E will propably be enough for them early ganks. Only thing I'm still slightly salty about is that those tasty first kill's at enemy red due to camouflage won't really be a thing anymore, but those were kinda stupid if I'm being honest with myself.
Her Charm is pretty strong for early ganks
What led to the decision to make her stealth only active post-level six, if I may ask? I'm not complaining, she seems super fun. I'm just curious.

Its pretty obvious: To take power from her pre-6 ganks (currently occupied by her non interactive stealth mechanic in the power budget) and distribute it to other, interactive, parts of her kit (e.g. she now has a hard cc again like way back in the day) so she is easier to tune (and play) between OP and useless while being fair to the enemy.

Having stealth pre-6 let to a lot of non intuitive gameplay for the enemy players (Warding camps is the optimal thing to do agaisnt her.) Since this was non intuitive many players don't do it against Eve, yet we have to balance her for the optimal case where players do know how to play against Eve early. It is part of why we had to make her more of a diver than a Assassin.

So, is Eve actually forced to teleport back after the Ult or can you cancel that? Because I'm pretty sure if the ult will not kill you might want to stick to the target, not be forced to blink the other way.
Dont F it up :)

Am I right to say Eve's textures, model and splash art have been updated/improved since her teaser?

On a side note I really don't care what her optimal build path is as long as her gameplay is fun and healthy. A fed rek sai can burst an ADC in 2.5 secs and she is a diver, so it is really ok. Plus Twitch and Rengar have taught us that camouflaged assassins are extremely hard to balance properly since their in and out pattern becomes abusive when they can engage from ward lines
Her detection radius is much larger than both Twitch and Renger's it seems (slightly larger than a lane's width).
Will Evelyn still have her ad scaling on her abilities or is she full ap now??

in all fairness it fits perfectly well with both rakan and eve, i think it would be a little silly to not allow other champions to have it just because its a part of ahri's core theme

I just feel like giving these champions Charms is akin to giving a new champion J4's flag drag, Tahm Kench's consume, Aurelion Sol's ~~balls~~ star orbit, Kalista's spear stacking + rend, etc.

It's great that they're working with design space they've left alone, but they've degraded Ahri's defining feature from "Charm" to "annoying mobility".

Lol?

Charm is just a type of CC, it's not a very specific signature move but rather just a form of movement impairing effects.

You're thinking "it's just a CC, lots of champions have that!", but it's a CC type only Ahri had since she was released which was season 2 iirc. It was iconic. Now all she has is some annoying mobility everyone hates her for and even that's not unique.

A lot of champions have overlapping things in their kits, it's bound to happen with 139+ champions and every new VGU.

She's still Ahri, new champions having charms won't devalue that.
You're not wrong or anything, I just feel like her kit isn't unique anymore, or at least in an interesting way.

Though I think they're trying to avoid making her SOLELY useful in the early game. She's striking me as more mid-game atm =/

**As a jungler I am struggling to understand her strategic niche in a team. **

* Pre level 6 she does nothing some other jg can't do better (Especially Elise).
* Her tower diving at lvl 6 is going to be good but Elise can do the same thing by level 3, with better cc, a point and click execute, and the ability to reset tower aggro with rappel.
* Her late game team fighting was unique due to her strong flank engages with her stealth plus the innate tankiness and slow from her ultimate, now she is just pretty much every other assassin in that she either needs to burst a target and run away or be super reliant on catching someone out of position.
* Not being able to sneak past ward lines until 6, increased detection radius and lust dust giving a warning reduces a lot of her original niche and fails to differentiate her from Rengar who can do a similar thing albeit with a cooldown
* The versatility in her build path with the ability to go ap/ad, glass cannon/tanky was also something I've always enjoyed and was pretty healthy but seems to be no longer supported.

Credit where credit is due the kit looks fun, especially Lust Dust which is a cool thematic ability, it briefly revealing her to the target will make it hard to pull off properly but it adds to the thematic well. **My problem is I do not understand the direction of her gameplay as it seems to be making her less unique **giving a person less reason to pick her unless she is over-tuned. For instance why not remove the execute and add a bind to her ultimate? A bind would still be thematic as well as give her back her niche as one of the best at flank engaging in team fights. Honestly I think giving back her stealth pre 6 would be the best thing although I can understand the arguments for why it should be removed.

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

[Edit]: For clarification this is not a complaint merely me inquiring as to where the design team thinks her niche is from a gameplay perspective. I do not mind her gameplay changing heavily, it does look fun and personally I think her thematic direction is fantastic, even if her VO is a tad... suggestive, so overall I think you did a good job.
